citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The facility representative explained that some of the animals that were listed on the itinerary were not available for
inspection at the listed site, Ripley County fairgrounds, on this day. They were moved for a day-trip exhibit at another
location. Animal Care did not receive a change in their itinerary, as verified by the licensee. It is important to submit an
itinerary, within the designated time frame, so that Animal Care is aware of regulated animal movement and exhibition
within the country, and inspections can be performed at all approved sites as efficiently as possible.
The licensee must submit an itinerary to the Deputy Administrator no fewer than two days in advance of any travel and
shall contain complete and accurate information concerning the whereabouts of any animal intended for exhibition at any
location other than the person’s approved site.
The itinerary must be accurate and up to date at all times.
Correction date: 7/29/2024

The water receptacle used for a goat was in a pen at the Ripley County fairgrounds. This receptacle was a white round
plastic tub and was partially filled with water. The water had a small amount of debris and hay floating on top. There was a
reddish-brown accumulation on the lower portion of the inside wall. The accumulation could be removed by firm rubbing
on the inside wall of the container. The facility representative used a rag to wipe most of the film from the inner walls as
we were evaluating the facility. The discolored film wasn’t just staining, as it was clearly removable. The facility
representative indicated that the water was filled as necessary, and the water receptacle was last thoroughly cleaned
approximately two weeks prior.
Contaminated water can lead to disease and adverse effects for the animals. Animals must have potable water provided
as necessary for the health and comfort of the animal. Water receptacles must be kept clean and sanitary at all times.
Correction date: 7/27/2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Robert Ferguson, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
